habitat: Coniferous, deciduous, mixed forests, birch forests, peaty soils, plains, hilly areas, acid oak forests, sandy soils, July to November.
shortDescription: Famous poisonous mushroom with bright red cap and white spots, contains alkaloids causing hallucinations, vomiting, nausea, can be fatal.
edibility: Poisonous, but some eat it for hallucinogenic effects after special preparation.
benefitsOrToxicity: Contains ibotenic acid, muscimol, muscarine, causes vomiting, nausea, headache, dizziness, hallucinations, salivation, weakness, low blood pressure, coma, death in large quantities.

identification.cap: 7-20 cm, hemispherical to flat, red to orange, covered with white flakes, striate margin.
identification.gills: White, free, crowded, turn pale yellow with age.
identification.stem: 7-20 cm, 1-4 cm diameter, cylindrical, bulbous base, white, wide ring, volva with concentric zones.
identification.flesh: Soft, white, yellowish under cap skin, no pronounced smell.
identification.microscopicFeatures: Spores 9.5-10.5 x 7-8 µm, broadly oval, smooth.

medicinalProperties: None, but used in some cultures for psychoactive effects.
note: Famous, associated with Santa Claus, Jesus theories, used as insecticide, varieties.
